MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Summary of Chapter 1. Worried about Fussen's continued unexplained absence,
I had paid a visit to her castle, when the dragon she keeps with her suddenly started to speak.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Excuse me.
I don't remember giving you permission to speak, Cinderella.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Yes. I spoke without being called on. But I feared that if I didn't intervene,
the conductor's opinion of you would be forever fixed as "an aristocrat with a foul mouth and bad attitude."

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
You are the one with a foul mouth. Tch. Do not utter such vile words in my castle. It's disgusting.
You're just a lowly bird.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
From our point of view, humans like you are lower life forms,
no better than bacteria.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
What?
Do you want to be roasted and eaten for dinner, you common lizard?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Do you really think a hairless ape like you has the
capacity to digest one of my species?

Excuse me for interrupting. Sorry, but I need you to explain something to me. You're talking as if it's completely normal, but what actually is that dragon? I'm certain there are no other monsters known to understand human language, other than Steel Seekers.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmph. You're still as ignorant as ever. In this world full of phantom mist, only "impossible" is impossible. I don't know much about those steel things, but as far as I do know, Cinderella here has always been talking her non-stop nonsense.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Every time she opens her mouth, she makes me so uncomfortable,
so I have to strictly enforce a rule that she never speak.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: In fact, those of us who you call monsters do have difficulty mastering human language, mainly because of our intelligence and vocal organs. I, too, am not strictly speaking, but am communicating directly to your brains using a very simple form of magic.

Ah. She's right, I cannot hear a voice.
It's not just a problem with my ears after all.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Yes. However, as you said, it's not often that a monster can understand human language.
I do not want to startle everyone unnecessarily, so I keep my mouth shut.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's not because I was ordered to do so by this foolish girl,
but because I voluntarily elect to remain silent.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I'll kill you. You're always defying me.
I'm sick of it. I wish I could just throw you out of here.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I am not serving you, but your parents, his lordship and her ladyship.
If you wish to deal with their wrath, you are free to do so.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I am still your family's greatest treasure, and the source of much pride. If you were to dispose of me without permission,
you would very likely be disowned this time.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's only because of your self-indulgent behavior that
his lordship and her ladyship are so upset.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Boo hoo.
You lowly reptilian, always sheltering yourself behind my parents' authority.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Who has proven that humans are a greater species than reptiles? In fact, I'm technically an unclassifiable monster - a high-ranking dragon,
so I'm not even a reptile.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
You always have to have the last word.
You're seriously so annoying.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Anyway. I'll introduce you again to the conductor. This dragon is a sort of butler for our family.
Her name is Cinderella.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: She is a servant made to obey us through the use of monster wielding, a unique ability that we members of the family that inherits the "Ancient Great Blood" are proud of. Feel free to call her "Bastard Lizard", because she don't deserve a name like Cinderella, the beautiful princess.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's not that I particularly want you to call me that. Cinderella is more of a term of endearment,
whereas my real name is Neuschwanstein.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: One of her ancestors from several generations ago gave me the nickname, inspired by the famous fairy tale. She was a great woman. It's a pity that the quality of her descendants is getting lower and lower!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
This is the first time in a long time that an heiress has developed the ability to wield monsters, but her beautiful appearance is not accompanied by any substance.
I truly despair for the future of this family.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hah?
You can talk bad about my family all you want, but you are not permitted to speak ill of me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Isn't it usually the other way around?
Isn't that the point, Miss Fussen?

Hmm...
That's right, Fussen can control monsters with ease.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Well,
unfortunately, it's not as easy as I'd like it to be.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yes. Especially since the monsters these days are either heavily tainted by the phantom mist ,or are completely different beings that are born from the mist itself. Even the young lady who inherited the Ancient Great Blood is not able to control them unconditionally.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Well, it depends on training, but as you know, this girl is very lazy.
I don't know where I went wrong in raising her.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I don't recall being raised by you, Cinderella.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hehe. When you were a little girl, you were a spoiled brat who would hug me and sob because you missed your parents. That kind of talk is laughable. Who do you think was cleaning up after you when you wet yourself?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Forget it. I will kill you.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I will not forget it.
Watching over you was my sole joy.
Continue to Chapter 3.
